page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The villages of Hullavington and Lower Stanton St.Quintin are situated between Chippenham and Malmesbury on the Southern end of the Cotswold Hills.The highest point of the area is over 107 metres above sea level.The ground is gently undulating and is highest in the South West corner.It is crossed by 3 small streams which flow Eastwards into the River Avon.One of them is called the Gauze Brook.The most distinctive buildings are the hangars on the R.A.F.Camp.Most of the village buildings are roofed and constructed with Jurassic oolitic limestone.Also near The C amp there is a little wood which is called Stock Wood.There is more grass around the concrete runway than the actual concrete.
